questions.question_text:
For real numbers $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, $$\gamma$$ and $$\delta $$, if 
$$\int {{{({x^2} - 1) + {{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \over {({x^4} + 3{x^2} + 1){{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)}}dx} $$

 $$ = \alpha {\log _e}\left( {{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \right) + \beta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{\gamma ({x^2} + 1)} \over x}} \right) + \delta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right) + C$$ 

where C is an arbitrary constant, then the value of 10($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$$$\gamma$$ + $$\delta$$) is equal to ______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: For real numbers $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, $$\gamma$$ and $$\delta $$, if $$\int {{{({x^2} - 1) + {{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \over {({x^4} + 3{x^2} + 1){{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)}}dx} $$ $$ = \alpha {\log _e}\left( {{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \right) + \beta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{\gamma ({x^2} + 1)} \over x}} \right) + \delta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right) + C$$ where C is an arbitrary constant, then the value of 10($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$$$\gamma$$ + $$\delta$$) is equal to ______________.

questions.question_text:
Statement I : A cyclist is moving on an unbanked road with a speed of 7 kmh$$-$$1 and takes a sharp circular turn along a path of radius of 2m without reducing the speed. The static friction coefficient is 0.2. The cyclist will not slip and pass the curve. (g = 9.8 m/s2)

Statement II : If the road is banked at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$, cyclist can cross the curve of 2m radius with the speed of 18.5 kmh$$-$$1 without slipping.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct
options.B: Both statement I and statement II are true
options.C: Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect
options.D: Both statement I and statement II are false

questions.question: Statement I : A cyclist is moving on an unbanked road with a speed of 7 kmh^{$$-$$1} and takes a sharp circular turn along a path of radius of 2m without reducing the speed. The static friction coefficient is 0.2. The cyclist will not slip and pass the curve. (g = 9.8 m/s^{2})Statement II : If the road is banked at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$, cyclist can cross the curve of 2m radius with the speed of 18.5 kmh^{$$-$$1} without slipping.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text:
A large block of wood of mass M = 5.99 kg is hanging from two long massless cords. A bullet of mass m = 10 g is fired into the block and gets embedded in it. The (block + bullet) then swing upwards, their centre of mass rising a vertical distance h = 9.8 cm before the (block + bullet) pendulum comes momentarily to rest at the end of its arc. The speed of the bullet just before collision is :
 (take g = 9.8 ms-2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A large block of wood of mass M = 5.99 kg is hanging from two long massless cords. A bullet of mass m = 10 g is fired into the block and gets embedded in it. The (block + bullet) then swing upwards, their centre of mass rising a vertical distance h = 9.8 cm before the (block + bullet) pendulum comes momentarily to rest at the end of its arc. The speed of the bullet just before collision is : (take g = 9.8 ms^{-2})
